# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    start_index = 1
    for i in eachindex(str)
        if (i - start_index) > text_width
            push!(lines, str[start_index:i-1])
            start_index = i + 1
        end
    end
    push!(lines, str[start_index:end])
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
str = "Hello there, this is a very long string that I would like to wrap at 10 characters per line. How does it look now?"
println(wrap_string(str))
```

This function iterates over the characters in `str` and builds an array of lines where each line has a maximum length of `text_width` characters. It ensures that when a word or group of characters would exceed the specified width, it is wrapped to the next line. The final string is constructed by joining these lines with newline characters.
